Action.author: xixuejia
Action.body: Just noticed that metrics/types.go and metrics/tally_provider.go are subsets of tally's types.go and scope.go. Is there any specific reason why you wrap a subset of tally's existing interfaces and implementations? ~grapebaba

Action.author: grapebaba
Action.body: ~xixuejia I think we should define own metrics interface in fabric, tally is just current default implementation. In further we may use other implementation even customize and no change in caller code. That is why I just implement count and gauge methods, for timer and histogram methods we also need consider more general. Indeed current interfaces derived from tally, however it is enough general right now.

Action.author: grapebaba
Action.body: I investigated several metrics library before, including native prometheus, statsd, go-metrics lib; some differences especially for Histogram. I suspect the interfaces defined by tally may not be implemented easily by other metrics lib.
